column4: hello.. just installed ubuntu 11.04 but I can't connect to my WLAN network (uses WPA).. can someone help me?
in terminal "iwlist scan"
it lists a number of WLANs there.. also mine.. I've set it up in the network manager but it doesn't connect
Do you use WPA or WPA2
WPA-PSK 256 bit
any idea what could be wrong?
ABout the wireless
Maybe try a static ip and manual DNS
the problem is it doesn't even connect.. keyphrase is 100% right
Which wireless card and ubuntu version + do other computers connect?
Ubuntu 11.04 according to lspci it's a Intel PRO/Wireless 2200BG [Calexico2]
Is this a recent issue or was it always not working
just installed Ubuntu.. wasn't working before
No idea on that
I know someone who had the same problem for the same card on Ubuntu they solved it by changing TKIP/AES to just TKIP in the router config
will try if it works with WEP.. can't change it to just TKIP
That should work ... also maybe an alternative network manager ... for that person the issue was only with Gnome's network manager but on Kde it worked
I'm using the Unity UI.. is that Gnome or KDE?
do you know how to do it on the cmd line?
Gnome
Yes but its quite complex
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/WPAHowTo
I've created that /etc/wpa_supplicant.conf file and tried to connect.. now I get a CTR-EVENT-DISCONNECTED when doing sudo wpa_supplicant -ieth1 -c/etc/wpa_supplicant.conf
